title: Augusta County: John Scott to Samuel Hunt, January 2, 1865
summary: Scott composes a letter to accompany a monthly report. The letter outlines school activities during the Christmas holidays and highlights the contributions local blacks made to help acquire additional buildings to be converted into schoolhouses. Scott also elaborates on the success of the AMA Sunday schools in Staunton.
keywords: African Americans, Education, Economy, Church/Religious Activity, American Civil War
